column4: I'm trying to find tips where to start troubleshooting on why my mp3-player wont pop up as /dev/sda1. Any ideas?
take a look at the output of dmesg
maybe do 'dmesg|tail -f' in a console window, and unplug and plug it in
When I checked the output of dmesg the only thing regarding usb I could find was seomthing with coreusb finding some hub
if you run 'dmesg|tail -f' you should see things change as they happen
alternatively, try 'lsusb' when the device is attached
you can paste the output of that to the pastebin: http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl
anyway, lsusb should at least list something, even if nothing is plugged in (as far as i know)
It didn't even notice the usb, maybe I'll try another usb port or something if the one on my motherboard hasn't been found by ubuntu..
hmm. sorry, i'm not sure what the problem is, but it does sound like your usb ports aren't being detected
you can maybe look at System -> Administration -> Device manager and see if anything USB related is listed there
if so, this module (on my machine) /lib/modules/2.6.10-5-386/kernel/drivers/block/loop.ko
